programme.title: Mana trakā ģimene 17
programme.desc: Pavisam “parasto” Grifinu ģimeni no izdomātās Rodailendas pilsētiņas droši var raksturot kā neaudzinātu, izlutinātu un absolūti nekorektu. Pītera un Luisas Grifinu jaunākais bērns ir inteliģents, sadistisks mazulis, kurš pastāvīgi meklē savu māti un kaļ plānus par pasaules pārņemšanu. Dēlam Krisam ir tikpat zems intelekta līmenis kā viņa tēvam, meita Mega veltīgi cenšas sadraudzēties ar “foršajiem cilvēkiem”, taču vienmēr tiek atstumta. Tikmēr runājošais un martīni malkojošais ģimenes suns Braiens ir vienīgais, kam ir kaut kripatiņa saprāta.

programme.title: Iznik, The Sunken Enigma
programme.desc: We follow a world-renowned team excavating the sunken remains of a 4th-century A.D. / C.E. Byzantine basilica in Lake Iznik in Turkey; how and why was it destroyed, and what happened to its community?

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Inside Man
programme.desc: As a witness to some of the darkest chapters of human history, Polish officer Witold Pilecki was the first man to inform the Allies about the reality of the Holocaust from inside Auschwitz.

programme.title: Nazi Killing Fields
programme.desc: March 1945: a special unit of the SS feels disturbed by wandering forced labourers in the West when their commander orders a massacre; this was a war crime that remained unpunished for decades.

programme.title: Churchills Forgotten War
programme.desc: In the summer of 1940, Churchill had taken power and the decision to arrest UK citizens originating from Germany, Austria and Italy; many were perfectly innocent men and some were Jewish refugees.

programme.title: Unearthed: Ancient Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Homicide detective Rod Demery and scientist Professor Turi King investigate Europes most famous ancient murder victim, who was frozen where he was killed over 5000 years ago.
programme.desc: Homicide detective Rod Demery and scientist Professor Turi King use modern techniques to investigate historys most intriguing murders; they visit Italy, Scotland, Denmark and the US.

programme.title: Conquistadors: The Rise and Fall
programme.sub-title: Disdain for Spains wealth in the Americas leads to other European rulers propagating an anti-Spanish narrative; the Black Legend is born and heralds the end of the era of conquistadors.
programme.desc: Popular culture has painted the Conquistadors as brave Christian pioneers, but a shifting narrative has revealed a darker story to their rise and fall.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: How great was the Nazi belief in the occult? Was Hitler behind it, or was this mostly Himmlers doing, and did Nazi generals believe in the occult and attend secret ceremonies?
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Great Pyramid at Giza in Egypt is a wonder of the world, but when was it built, for what purpose, and by who, and what can the earliest pyramid of Djoser at Saqqara add to the argument?
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Strangest Things
programme.sub-title: What is the purpose of the strange bronze Roman dodecahedrons that have baffled archaeologists for centuries, and is a Middle Eastern metal scroll a guide to billions of dollars of buried treasure?
programme.desc: Hidden away in museums, laboratories, and storage rooms around the world are the most remarkable objects on Earth; using new research and technology, we get under their skin like never before.

programme.title: Strangest Things
programme.sub-title: Is a corroded lump of bronze found on the sea floor really a 2,000-year-old computer, and was a 1,000-pound World War Two bomb really piloted by a pigeon?
programme.desc: Hidden away in museums, laboratories, and storage rooms around the world are the most remarkable objects on Earth; using new research and technology, we get under their skin like never before.

programme.title: The Frontier
programme.sub-title: The territory of California proves invaluable as the discovery of gold unleashes the largest migration in US history and ignites a debate on slavery that culminates in the American Civil War.
programme.desc: This series explores the legends, events and folklore of the American frontier, a place that has become part of one of the defining periods of American national identity.

programme.title: The Frontier
programme.sub-title: A race of the railroads to join the East and West Coasts begins a new chapter in US dominance and leads to the rise of an American icon: the cowboy.
programme.desc: This series explores the legends, events and folklore of the American frontier, a place that has become part of one of the defining periods of American national identity.

programme.title: The Frontier
programme.sub-title: As the century draws to a close, the scars of systematic ethnic cleansing of native peoples - along with US claims on land - seemingly ends the frontier chapter in American history.
programme.desc: This series explores the legends, events and folklore of the American frontier, a place that has become part of one of the defining periods of American national identity.

programme.title: Adolf Hitler: Decoding A Dictator
programme.sub-title: The Third Reich was governed according to the Fuhrerprinzip, but Hitlers rule would not have been possible without the support of the people and organisations that made his tyranny possible.
programme.desc: This series explores six distinctive aspects of the life and rule of Adolf Hitler and questions how a 30-year-old uneducated nobody was able to leave a legacy of unprecedented evil.

programme.title: The Masters of the Reich
programme.sub-title: Hitler used confrontations between economic crises and street violence to provoke the need for more authoritarian power; the ordinary man with political genius became the Chancellor of Peace.
programme.desc: This series sheds a new light on the Second World War by revealing what the masters of the Reich and their acolytes were really saying to each other while being filmed thinking no-one could hear them.

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: Ramses the Great has earned the distinction of being the most feared and respected pharaoh when he signs the first true peace treaty in human history with longstanding foes the Hittites.
programme.desc: Featuring unique access to the latest archaeological discoveries, this series exposes the man behind a myth and reveals how the mighty Ramses has remained a caricature of his own propaganda.

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: Ramses reaches the 30th year of his reign as a pharaoh of unparalleled achievements, but he has little time to savour his lengthy tenure on the throne amid the grandeur.
programme.desc: Featuring unique access to the latest archaeological discoveries, this series exposes the man behind a myth and reveals how the mighty Ramses has remained a caricature of his own propaganda.

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: Ramses fortified borders and established peace with other kingdoms during his long reign; his 13th son Merenptah must strive to uphold his fathers legacy, but will his efforts prove sufficient?
programme.desc: Featuring unique access to the latest archaeological discoveries, this series exposes the man behind a myth and reveals how the mighty Ramses has remained a caricature of his own propaganda.

programme.title: Auschwitz - One Day
programme.desc: This documentary tells the story of a typical day in 1944 at the concentration camp of Auschwitz; it is based on a unique document which is kept in the Israeli memorial site of Yad Vashem.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: This episode focuses on Guernsey, an island which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: The Maisy Battery was made up of three-and-a-half miles of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc that tell a new story of D-Day.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: The Spanish island of Villa Winter was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Kraftwerk Nord West was one of the largest Nazi bunkers ever; constructed outside of the French town of Watten, it was a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles and two launch pads.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: The Black Pharaohs
programme.desc: About 4000 years ago, strong kings ruled for over 1500 years in the land of Kush (now northern Sudan and southern Egypt) - who were these African kings and what happened to them?

programme.title: Mesopotamia Rediscovered
programme.desc: A new generation of archaeologists reopens the mythical Mesopotamian sites of Nineveh, Lagash and Larsa; using new technologies, they make astounding discoveries in the very first cities built by man.

programme.title: Forgotten Frontlines
programme.sub-title: The Battle of Castle Itter is the strangest WWII battle the world has never heard of, and the only battle where the Allies joined forces with Germans to defeat the Nazis.
programme.desc: Some pieces of the narrative seem to have slipped through the cracks of our collective memory of WWII; we journey to fill in the gaps and shed light on the war efforts that youve never heard of.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare
programme.sub-title: The greatest 20th-century commanders understood warfare at both strategic and tactical level; some instilled loyalty in their troops through fear and intimidation while others inspired confidence.
programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a complex containing more than 1,000 structures across 25 square kilometres.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: The Masters of the Reich
programme.sub-title: Decoding tools reveal exchanges between the Fuhrer and his allies; Hitler morphs from political leader to military strategist; the masters of the Reich unleash a world war in seven years.
programme.desc: This series sheds a new light on the Second World War by revealing what the masters of the Reich and their acolytes were really saying to each other while being filmed thinking no-one could hear them.

programme.title: Adolf Hitler: Decoding A Dictator
programme.sub-title: Architecture mattered a great deal to Adolf Hitler; his grandiose visions were not merely buildings, but symbols of a tyrannical vision intended to impose a sense of domination upon the the world.
programme.desc: This series explores six distinctive aspects of the life and rule of Adolf Hitler and questions how a 30-year-old uneducated nobody was able to leave a legacy of unprecedented evil.

programme.title: Cities of the Underworld
programme.sub-title: Don follows the clues hidden underground as he searches for evidence of 10,000 Aztecs who fled Mexico and disappeared somewhere in America.
programme.desc: Don Wildman attempt to shine new light on the most vexing mysteries of our past and delves deep as he journeys to the ends of the Earth travelling to historys most ancient places.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Bermuda Triangle is a loosely defined region, in the western part of the North Atlantic Ocean, where a number of aircraft and ships are said to have been abandoned or disappeared.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: Starring in only a handful of films, Bruce Lee is revered as an icon in popular culture, but Lee died as young and as suddenly as his son. How could their tragic destinies share so many similarities?
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: The Habsburgs were the most powerful family in Europe for centuries; why was their destiny so fatal, and were all their tribulations connected to some kind of curse?
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The crucifixion of Jesus changed the world; how much of our understanding of this event is true, and what answers can be found in the Holy Land to back up the Bibles story?
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Strangest Things
programme.sub-title: Can a shred of metal dug up on a 1,000-year-old native American site really be Viking, and is a strange fired clay disk discovered on Crete really the product of Europes earliest civilisation?
programme.desc: Hidden away in museums, laboratories, and storage rooms around the world are the most remarkable objects on Earth; using new research and technology, we get under their skin like never before.

programme.title: The Black Pharaohs
programme.desc: About 4000 years ago, strong kings ruled for over 1500 years in the land of Kush (now northern Sudan and southern Egypt) - who were these African kings and what happened to them?

programme.title: Cities of the Underworld
programme.sub-title: Don follows the clues hidden underground as he searches for evidence of 10,000 Aztecs who fled Mexico and disappeared somewhere in America.
programme.desc: Don Wildman attempt to shine new light on the most vexing mysteries of our past and delves deep as he journeys to the ends of the Earth travelling to historys most ancient places.

programme.title: The Frontier
programme.sub-title: As the century draws to a close, the scars of systematic ethnic cleansing of native peoples - along with US claims on land - seemingly ends the frontier chapter in American history.
programme.desc: This series explores the legends, events and folklore of the American frontier, a place that has become part of one of the defining periods of American national identity.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: During WWI, men had to endure combat and extreme conditions; civilians dealt with food shortages and raids. The insidiousness of ethnic cleansing raised its head, and a young Adolf Hitler took note.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.sub-title: Japan would create arguably the greatest fighter in WWII - the Mitsubishi Zero - but their failed war factories would ultimately reduce the Zero to a kamikaze plane.
programme.desc: No matter how many soldiers you have, how clever your generals or how daring your strategy, you will not win a war if you dont have enough bullets, planes, or food. WW2 was a war of the factories...

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: The Nazis had all but lost the war by March of 1945, but Hitler still sent throngs of soldiers to protect an isolated area of occupied Poland from oncoming forces. What was he trying to hide?
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Conquistadors: The Rise and Fall
programme.sub-title: Disdain for Spains wealth in the Americas leads to other European rulers propagating an anti-Spanish narrative; the Black Legend is born and heralds the end of the era of conquistadors.
programme.desc: Popular culture has painted the Conquistadors as brave Christian pioneers, but a shifting narrative has revealed a darker story to their rise and fall.

programme.title: Forgotten Frontlines
programme.sub-title: Between September 1944 and February 1945, US troops fought their longest battle in history; they never suspected that progress would be so slow that it would be measured in yards.
programme.desc: Some pieces of the narrative seem to have slipped through the cracks of our collective memory of WWII; we journey to fill in the gaps and shed light on the war efforts that youve never heard of.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare
programme.sub-title: What defines a successful fighting force? Warfare has changed radically over the last century, and armed forces have had to adapt to new technologies and tactics.
programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: A secret weapons programme in the heart of Austria could have ended badly for the Allies and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Ancient Superstructures
programme.sub-title: Nestled in the Jordanian desert, Petra is regarded as the eighth wonder of the world; scientists are still fascinated by its facades carved into the rock, its temples, and its unique hydraulic system.
programme.desc: We delve into the engineering mysteries behind the worlds most famous ancient structures by observing them from perspectives ranging from satellite imagery right down to macro and microscopic levels.

programme.title: Ancient Superstructures
programme.sub-title: Hidden in the rainforest, Tikal was the capital of the most powerful kingdom built by the Maya; now new technologies such as LiDar allow researchers to reveal new secrets about this exceptional place.
programme.desc: We delve into the engineering mysteries behind the worlds most famous ancient structures by observing them from perspectives ranging from satellite imagery right down to macro and microscopic levels.

programme.title: Cloverfield
programme.desc: Selles loos puudub eellugu, põhjused ja tagajarjed. Hiiglaslik kosmosest tulnud koletis rundab New Yorki, kulvates kost ja havingut, kaamera aga salvestab kaputaie inimese puudeid eluga paaseda.

programme.title: Hundijaht
programme.desc: Filipiinidelt Lõuna-Koreasse transporditavad ohtlikud kurjategijad puuavad laevalt põgeneda ja algab mass, mille kaigus paastavad laeval valla sunged uleloomulikud jõud.

programme.title: Cryo
programme.desc: Viis teadlast arkavad maa-aluses laboris kruoonilisest unest ega maleta, kes nad on või kuidas uinusid. Peagi selgub šokeeriv tõde, et neid jahib palgamõrvar.

programme.title: Ellujaaja
programme.desc: USA valisministeeriumi tootaja sõidab toolahetusele Londonisse, et hoida ara terrorirunnak, ent tema plaan nurjub esimesest hetkest alates. 2015

programme.title: Musketar
programme.desc: Alexandre Dumas romaani on taiendatud idamaisete nootidega. DArtagnan unistab liitumisest kuninga elitaarsete ihukaitsjate musketaridega ja leida mees, kes tappis tema vanemad.

programme.title: Uus tutar
programme.desc: Üksikisa kolib oma kahe lapsega Lõuna-Carolina maakohta. Seal markab ta, et tema tutar hakkab aina kummalisemalt kaituma.

programme.title: Transformerid: Valjasuremine
programme.desc: Inimkond loob kaed pearahakutiga, et tabada Optimus Prime. Autobotid poorduvad mehaaniku pere poole, et abi saada.

programme.title: Laenatud aeg
programme.desc: Tere tulemast tulevikku, kus kõige kõvem valuuta on aeg! Inimesed vananevad 25. eluaastani. Rikkad on sisuliselt surematud, vaesed aga surevad jalapealt, kui ei suuda aega juurde hankida.

programme.title: Vanguard
programme.desc: Palgamõrvarite bande Arktika Hundid roovib hiina arimehe koos tutrega. Politsei kaed on seotud ja appi tuleb salateenistuse professionaalne uksus Vanguard eesotsas Jackie Chani tegelaskujuga.

programme.title: Kurikakuningas

programme.title: Kuidas inglase moodi armatseda?
programme.desc: Ülikooli professor Richard Haig armub naisesse, kelle parast hindab ta umber oma siiani liiderliku elu. Asjad muutuvad keeruliseks, kui temast jaab rasedaks tema tudengist kallima poolõde. 2014

programme.title: Purunenud maja
programme.desc: Ema ja isa sõidavad puhkusereisile ja jatavad pojad kodu valvama. Kahel loodril ei tule pahe midagi targemat, kui uurida maja osade kaupa kõige veidramatele uurnikele, keda oli võimalik leida. 2009

programme.title: Zambesia
programme.desc: Pistrikupoeg kannatab uksinduse kaes. Ta unistab lindude paradiisilinnast Zambesiast. Sealt loodab ta leida ustavaid sõpru, põnevaid seiklusi ja oma unistuste taitumist.

programme.title: Pulmakohting
programme.desc: Peategelane saab kutse noorema õe pulma ja tal on kiiresti vaja kaaslast sugulastele ja eksile naitamiseks. Ta palkab eskortteenuste firmast endale fiktiivse kallima.

programme.title: Ma ei tea, kuidas ta seda teeb
programme.desc: Kate puuab uhendada karjaari ja pereelu. Kui talle pakutakse tood, mis eeldab sagedast reisimist ja tema mees saab kauaoodatud arhitektuuriprojekti, hakkab olukord kontrolli alt libisema. 2011

programme.title: Lapsehoidja
programme.desc: Vanemad paluvad meessoost tookaaslast hoida nende poega. Jargmisel paeval teatab politsei, et nende kodu on segi pekstud, poeg kadunud, majast leiti videokaamera. Mida sellega kull salvestati? 2014

programme.title: Kutt, abiellu minuga
programme.desc: Andekas Maroko tudeng, kes tuleb Pariisi õppima, ei ilmu eksamile. Nuud peab ta riigist lahkuma või leidma viisi seaduslikult jaada. Abi oleks fiktiivsest abielust, ent kes sellega nõustuks? 2017

programme.title: Elizabethtown
programme.desc: Kentuckys sundinud isa malestustseremoonial kodulinnas kohtub noor peategelane ootamatult stjuuardessiga ja algab armulugu, mis naib liiga ilus, et olla tõsi.

programme.title: Keegi Joe
programme.desc: Joe laheb laste toole kaasa võtmise paeval toole koos tutrega ja saab tema nahes tookaaslase kaest peksa. Mees otsustab katte maksta.

programme.title: Mees, kes ei aimanud
programme.desc: Videolaenutuses tootavat ameeriklast peetakse rahvusvaheliseks spiooniks, samal ajal kui tema peab spioonimaailmas ringi koperdades kõike toimuvat tanavateatri etenduseks.

programme.title: Eksnaiste klubi
programme.desc: Kolm lahutatud naist kohtuvad kolledžiaegse sõbranna matusel ja hakkavad hauduma kattemaksu meestele, kes on nad nooremate naiste parast maha jatnud.

programme.title: Miks ma abiellusin? (2007)
programme.desc: Tyler Perry naidendi adaptsioon suurele ekraanile abielu katsumustest ja sellest, mis juhtub uhe tavalise perega, kui lavale astub seksikas noor võrgutaja.

programme.title: Kahandamine
programme.desc: Sotsiaalne satiir, kus peategelane mõistab, et tema elu oleks edukam, kui ta kahandaks end 12 cm pikkuseks ning elaks kulluses ja luksuslikult.

programme.title: Rõõmurull
programme.desc: 30-aastane algkooliõpetaja Poppy liigub labi elu naerdes. Ta saab mangleva kergusega hakkama koolilastega ja suhtleb taiesti vabalt ka võhivõõrastega.

programme.title: Elumeeste kool
programme.desc: Saanud jarjekordse korvi, registreerub Roger dr. P kursustele, mis lubavad kasvatada enesekindlust. Kasutatavad meetodid on aga nii uudsed, et muutvad kohati teistele ja osalejale endalegi ohtlikuks.

programme.title: 1+1 on pere
programme.desc: Seelikukutt Sami muretu elu muutub hetkega põrguks. Tema hoolde usaldatakse imik, kes on vaidetavalt tema tutar. Otsides maimukese ema satub ta võõrasse riiki ilma raha ja toota, ent oma lapsega... 2016

programme.title: Kohtingufilm
programme.desc: Romantiliste komoodiate paroodia, mille keskmes on meespeategelane, tema armastuse objekt, mehe vanemad ja naise isa.

programme.title: Varuplaan
programme.desc: Naine jaab kunstliku viljastamise tulemusel kaksikute ootele. Samal paeval kohtab ta oma unistuste meest.

programme.title: Kui tahtis on olla tõsine
programme.desc: Lõbus lugu 1890ndate aastate Londonist, kus kaks sõpra kasutavad sama pseudonuumi Earnest, et varjata oma salajasi ettevõtmisi.

programme.title: Uljad uisuvelled

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: The team prepares to release two beautiful and elusive spotted cats called servals - meanwhile, its all hands on deck when a baby monkey arrives in critical condition.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James sees an emergency case involving two pets, Dr Kiara has concerns about a lump on blue-tongue skink Edward, and Dr Kelly performs tiny surgery on two very small German ram fish.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: Discover how some of the worlds most extraordinary animals are also the smallest. This action-packed episode will take you deep into rainforests, under the oceans and across vast deserts.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian rushes to a local farm where a heifer is struggling to give birth; Boris the cat pays a visit because hes been in another road accident in Thirsk, but Peters not sure if there is any hope.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian is called out in the middle of the night to save a cow that has prolapsed her uterus whilst giving birth; in Thirsk, sheep farmer Richard Todd has rushed in to see Peter.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its Julzs last week; an encounter with lions scatters the Stork pack, Julz spots the Kakuli puppies feeding on a puku carcass, and the Manzi pack fight a warthog by the Luangwa River.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: The team prepares to release two beautiful and elusive spotted cats called servals - meanwhile, its all hands on deck when a baby monkey arrives in critical condition.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James sees an emergency case involving two pets, Dr Kiara has concerns about a lump on blue-tongue skink Edward, and Dr Kelly performs tiny surgery on two very small German ram fish.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: Some species have baffled scientists. We discover the biological marvel that is the saiga antelope, the odd diets of the gelada baboons and greater bamboo lemurs and much more.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Join Julz and park scout Simon Chulu as they track the Kakuli pack and a Manzi faction thats ditched a tracking collar and broken away from the group.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: A special episode focusing on births and babies; Julian heads to a local farm where a cow is struggling in labour, and baby goat Daisy has serious eye problems that are affecting her sight.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian rushes to a dramatic emergency at Jackie Barlows alpaca farm; with things returning to normal post-Covid, Peter returns to the Greens farm, where theres now lots of veterinary work to do.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian races to an emergency at a local farm where a cow is unable to stand up, and Peter tries to save three-week-old Sphynx kitten Dobby; his tiny patient has pneumonia.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: New Zealand: Earths Mythical Islands
programme.sub-title: Isolated since the time of the dinosaurs, New Zealands wildlife has been left to its own devices and its forests are stalked by predators from the Jurassic era.
programme.desc: The mysterious and unexpected story of an exotic, magnificent and isolated island chain as we discover New Zealands wildest places and its most resilient pioneers.

programme.title: Wild Talk
programme.sub-title: We explore the latest science around how animals communicate with each other by using a variety of visual signals and physical movements.
programme.desc: Recent years have seen an explosion of research into zoosemiotics (the science of animal communications); experts are listening to animals on their own terms to decode their secret languages.

programme.title: Natures Mass Attacks
programme.sub-title: In the battle to eat or be eaten, its not always the mighty that win; featuring animals from the gigantic to the miniature, this is a fascinating look at the tactics used by predator and prey.
programme.desc: We follow the worlds best pack hunters; from the iconic grey wolf to the surprising collaboration between humans and dolphins, these are predators at their most inventive and cunning.

programme.title: Natures Mass Attacks
programme.sub-title: We focus on the iconic migratory animals of Africa, North America and Oceania as they travel long distances through some of the worlds most stunning landscapes and battle extreme odds of survival.
programme.desc: We follow the worlds best pack hunters; from the iconic grey wolf to the surprising collaboration between humans and dolphins, these are predators at their most inventive and cunning.

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.sub-title: Family is everything; many species live in families, clans, or groups. The survival of each individual depends on the family, and the family depends on the union of all its components.
programme.desc: Animals fight to ensure their survival, but what are the reasons that make them risk their lives every day, and what are the consequences of winning or losing these battles?

programme.title: Wonders of Mexico
programme.sub-title: Mexico is a vast country; over 2,000 miles long, its dominated by a great chain of mountains known as the Sierra Madre. Journey down this rocky spine and youll discover an amazing diversity of life.
programme.desc: This documentary series reveals Mexicos astonishing wildlife, landscape and culture as we pay a visit to the ancient temples of the Maya, the Sierra Madre, and the Sonoran and Chihuahuan deserts.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Summer is the season of extremes, but things arent as simple as hot and cold; the top of the planet is in 24 hours of sunlight by June while the bottom is frozen in darkness.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Autumn is the season of change; change brings opportunity for many but also huge challenges. Time is running out and preparedness is key as the year draws to a close and winter returns.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: The Worlds Most Beautiful Landscapes
programme.sub-title: Discover the secrets of the extraordinary landscape of Queensland, Australia, from its great national parks and rich Aboriginal history to the wonders of the coral of the Great Barrier Reef.
programme.desc: Travel through the worlds most beautiful landscapes; from wide views to the tiniest close-up, witness spectacular footage and discover the glories of rivers, jungles, and mountains from every angle.

programme.title: Natures Ultimate Survivors
programme.sub-title: We reveal natures stealthiest and most deceptive creatures; these wild contenders have perfected the art of blending into their surroundings, but which one takes the crown as our master of disguise?
programme.desc: We explore a diverse range of topics that showcase the incredible survival skills animals have developed over time and feature our top 20 animal species for each of these categories.

programme.title: Natures Fast Attacks
programme.sub-title: This first episode features footage showing the lightning-fast moves that predators deploy to capture their prey and the rapid escape tactics that will see who wins these high-velocity battles.
programme.desc: In this two-part documentary series, we see footage that captures the lightning-fast moves used to ambush prey and make equally rapid escapes in the terrifying moments between life and death.

programme.title: Natures Fast Attacks
programme.sub-title: In the battle between predator and prey, we explore how deception and speed can often be the difference between life and death; even some of the fastest hunters use stealth to trick their prey.
programme.desc: In this two-part documentary series, we see footage that captures the lightning-fast moves used to ambush prey and make equally rapid escapes in the terrifying moments between life and death.

programme.title: Deadly Hunters
programme.sub-title: Careful where you step - hidden beneath logs, in trees, empty burrows and long grass are creatures so deadly that one bite is enough to take down a full-grown elephant.
programme.desc: We take a look at some of the animals that have led the way in refining their skills as masterful huntsmen; using their size, strength and unique weapons, animals use it all in order to survive.

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: Being thin, having black spots on whitish hair, hyperventilating and licking regularly to evaporate saliva are the cheetahs most efficient tricks for tolerating its fiery environment.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: Most species that live in extreme places are delaying their life cycles of reproduction and breeding; wild dogs are advancing their biology by several weeks to avoid the dangers of heat to their pups.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Massive Africa
programme.sub-title: The Okavango Delta is the prized jewel in Africas crown of monumental wildernesses; the worlds largest inland delta, its two million hectares of swamp glisten in unrivalled psychedelic displays.
programme.desc: An action-packed adventure through Africas last untamed majestic wildernesses; gain new perspective on the continents wonderlands, iconic natural marvels, and awe-inspiring wildlife spectacles.

programme.title: Massive Africa
programme.sub-title: Defined by the life-giving vein of the great Limpopo River - whose banks burst with some of Africas most iconic creatures - Mashatu tells an exciting tale of times past.
programme.desc: An action-packed adventure through Africas last untamed majestic wildernesses; gain new perspective on the continents wonderlands, iconic natural marvels, and awe-inspiring wildlife spectacles.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: Amanda goes on a white-knuckle bushwhacking adventure to rescue a waterbuck caught by a poachers snare, and Alma gets a mysterious late-night monkey delivery.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James treats a Boyds Forest dragon at the clinic, Dr Shane treats a carpet python called Red, and Dr Catherine sees an emergency case; sun conure parakeet Tequila is in a lot of pain.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: For natures giants, being the biggest brings huge advantages and challenges. From massive land mammals to ocean behemoths, how natures giants overcome lifes big problems is awe inspiring.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter is called to help Marshmallow, a little foal born just hours ago who cant take a vital first feed from mum; Julian performs surgery on new mum Bea, a Labrador whos eaten a large sock.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian sets up a blood bank at Jackies alpaca farm to take samples that could benefit any struggling crias born here; Peter rushes to help a cow struggling to give birth in the middle of the night.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its 100 degrees and rising; as waterholes dry up, Julz is alarmed to find lions in the Kakuli packs favourite drinking spot but also gets to touch a wild dog for the first time ever.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: Discover how some of the worlds most extraordinary animals are also the smallest. This action-packed episode will take you deep into rainforests, under the oceans and across vast deserts.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Julz and Henry from the ZCP track the Kakumbi pups as they face off with a warthog, and Thandie Mweetwa - ZCPs lion specialist - counts the prides that are pushing the Manzi out of their territory.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: This episode marks International Dog Day; Julian has performed lots of surgery on his clients four-legged friends, but its a bit different when the patient is his own faithful companion Emmy.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Bull Pip needs an urgent foot trim, but hes reluctant to lie down and allow Peter do his job; in Boroughbridge, Julian and Katy are operating on Berties the beagles leg.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Amadeus the alpaca has a stick in his eye which has caused a nasty injury, and Peter greets a familiar face from Down Under when a baby wallaby comes to the practice a little down in the dumps.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Natures Ultimate Survivors
programme.sub-title: We reveal natures stealthiest and most deceptive creatures; these wild contenders have perfected the art of blending into their surroundings, but which one takes the crown as our master of disguise?
programme.desc: We explore a diverse range of topics that showcase the incredible survival skills animals have developed over time and feature our top 20 animal species for each of these categories.

programme.title: Natures Fast Attacks
programme.sub-title: This first episode features footage showing the lightning-fast moves that predators deploy to capture their prey and the rapid escape tactics that will see who wins these high-velocity battles.
programme.desc: In this two-part documentary series, we see footage that captures the lightning-fast moves used to ambush prey and make equally rapid escapes in the terrifying moments between life and death.

programme.title: Natures Fast Attacks
programme.sub-title: In the battle between predator and prey, we explore how deception and speed can often be the difference between life and death; even some of the fastest hunters use stealth to trick their prey.
programme.desc: In this two-part documentary series, we see footage that captures the lightning-fast moves used to ambush prey and make equally rapid escapes in the terrifying moments between life and death.

programme.title: Deadly Hunters
programme.sub-title: Careful where you step - hidden beneath logs, in trees, empty burrows and long grass are creatures so deadly that one bite is enough to take down a full-grown elephant.
programme.desc: We take a look at some of the animals that have led the way in refining their skills as masterful huntsmen; using their size, strength and unique weapons, animals use it all in order to survive.

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.sub-title: Survival is based on eating; if there is no food, you cannot compete to mate, you cannot defend your family from any threat, and you will be unable to achieve good standing in your clan.
programme.desc: Animals fight to ensure their survival, but what are the reasons that make them risk their lives every day, and what are the consequences of winning or losing these battles?

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Jeremy travels to Germany, where he meets modern-day victims of a freshwater beast, and discovers first-hand in Spain that the Wels catfish is a living, breathing aggressive predator.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.sub-title: The language of love and the fight for reproduction stimulate the most striking and diverse behaviours of the animal world: dances, challenges, fights, pulses, and battles to mate with females.

programme.title: Europes Wilderness
programme.sub-title: Kira is a bearded vulture born in the Spanish Pyrenees and released into the wild in Switzerland at a young age; she is equipped with GPS by wildlife biologists so we can accompany her.
programme.desc: We present six of the largest, rarest and fastest animals in Europe; how does climate change affect them, and how do they defend their habitat against human influence?

programme.title: Europes Wilderness
programme.sub-title: Grey seals are less shy than the more famous harbour seals; camera close-ups dont scare them, so they allow us to follow them as they rest on the beach and hunt the waters for food.
programme.desc: We present six of the largest, rarest and fastest animals in Europe; how does climate change affect them, and how do they defend their habitat against human influence?

programme.title: Europes Wilderness
programme.sub-title: In the Bialowieza National Park in Poland is the last primeval forest of Europe; here lives the only European bison species. In untouched nature, we get to know their herd life.
programme.desc: We present six of the largest, rarest and fastest animals in Europe; how does climate change affect them, and how do they defend their habitat against human influence?

programme.title: Danube Fantasy
programme.desc: Filmmaker Braňo Molnár creates an emotional portrait of the Danube river, a home to hundreds of species of plants and animals that has witnessed drastic changes in recent years.
